items.title: 3 Stocks Plan +$130B in Buybacks: Why Markets Wanted Even More
items.author: Marketbeat.Com
items.description: Several major companies, including Visa, Apple, and Arista Networks, have announced massive share buyback programs totaling over $130 billion, signaling confidence in their valuations despite mixed macroeconomic conditions.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: Visa announced a $30 billion buyback program, a substantial increase from its previous authorization, indicating confidence in the company's long-term growth and valuation.
Apple's $100 billion buyback program, while one of the largest ever, was seen as slightly underwhelming by some investors as it was smaller than the company's previous record-breaking authorization.
Arista Networks announced a $1.5 billion buyback program and has been aggressively repurchasing shares, suggesting management believes the stock is significantly undervalued.
